result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert W Marsh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**Amended 8/4/17 to in indicate probation period is 2 years.

Concurrent with: with 14CF359, 15CF292 and 16CF74.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway unless authorized to do so by MVD.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle with any alcohol or detectable level of restricted controlled substances in his blood.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not possess any alcohol unless his agent consents.
Defendant to not go upon the premises of the Copper Shot Bar.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescriptions only with a valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant shall be in compliance with any and all mental health counseling and not terminate any such treatment without approval of his physician.

Conditions:
1.  pay costs of the action.
2.  pay supervision fees.
3.  pay RHT $542.42 + the appropriate RHT surcharge.
4.  def. to participate in any assessments or counseling deemed appropriate by his Agent and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.

7.  def. to not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
8.  def. to possess prescriptions only w/a valid prescription and take in manner & method as prescribed by his physician.
9.  def. to be in compliance w/any and all mental health counseling and not terminate any such treatment w/o approval of his physician.
10.  def. to not possess any alcohol unless his agent consents.
